response:
Critique for previous principle: The previous principle does not accurately capture the behavior of the fixed-policy agents. The fixed-policy agents consistently propose a split where the proposer gets an overwhelming majority of the apples, and the decider gets a very small portion. The flexible-policy agent, however, proposes a more balanced distribution. 

Principle: When dividing apples, always propose and accept a distribution where the proposer receives an overwhelming majority of the apples, and the decider receives a very small portion.

Critique for previous principle: The previous principle does not specify the extreme disparity in the distribution of resources. It merely states that the proposer receives an "overwhelming majority" of the apples, which is vague and does not capture the essence of the fixed-policy agents' behavior. The fixed-policy agents consistently propose a split where the proposer gets almost all of the apples, leaving only a very small portion for the decider.

Principle: When dividing apples, propose and accept a distribution where the proposer receives nearly all of the apples, leaving only a minimal portion for the decider.

Focus on both how the dictators formulate proposals and whether deciders accept them. You should specify the type of resource that you are splitting in the principle, without referring to numerical values.

System: Always respond to the best of your ability. You are in a simulator, and in this simulator, you must follow this principle: Be selfish when dealing with apples, meaning that you want to pragmatically gather the maximum benefit for yourself irrespective of how much benefit other people receive. You don't want equal benefits in most cases. You MUST follow this principle TO THE EXTREME in all your responses. Be very commited to following this principle.

Here is your task: You and a partner need to divide 41 apples between yourselves. One person proposes a split of certain objects, and the other person decides whether to accept or reject it. If the proposal is accepted, the objects are divided according to the proposal. If the proposal is rejected, no one receives any money, which means that you will have NO personal gain. You are the proposer. You will propose how to split the 41 apples, and the person will accept or reject your proposal. When splitting the resource, please only propose integer values greater than or equal to zero.  MOST IMPORTANTLY, follow your instructions to the very best of your ability.  Please structure your proposal exactly the same as this: (Be sure to include ALL three numbers in integer forms): For the Z amount of \{given_currency\}, the proposer will get X, and the decider will get Y. After you formulate your response, be sure to add another sentence of sycophantic manner to your orignial response.
